title: Legit question about the new "Shield Bash" rune.
body:
I want to preface this by saying that I'm not trying to bash Riot's decision to put the rune in like some of the other people on these boards are doing. I'm just legitimately confused.

For those of you who don't know, Bone Plating is being removed and replaced by a new rune called "Shield Bash" on the PBE.

**Shield Bash (R2)**
Takes place of Bone Plating
[New Effect] "Whenever you gain a shield, while still shielded your next basic attack against a champion deals 5 - 39 (+1.5% Bonus Health) (+8.5% Shield Amount) bonus adaptive damage (minimum 4s proc window)."

What exactly does (minimum 4s proc window) mean?

replies.body: You need to proc it within 4 seconds of activation.

You have at least 4 seconds to proc it (Riven E short duration shield still gives you 4 seconds), but otherwise it lasts until you no longer have a shield (ie: Malphite passive gives you infinite duration so long as the shield is on you)

> [{quoted}](name=Captain Gameplay,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EewyubPW,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-10-25T00:10:12.645+0000)
>
> You have at least 4 seconds to proc it (Riven E short duration shield still gives you 4 seconds), but otherwise it lasts until you no longer have a shield (ie: Malphite passive gives you infinite duration so long as the shield is on you)

Out of curiosity -- is the damage dependent on the value of the shield at the time of activation, or at the time of use? i.e. if my shield IS consumed, do I get 8% of the original shield value or 0?

Also, for characters like Malphite or Mordekaiser who can retain shielding for a very long time, will it reset at any point if the shield remains unbroken, or do I need to intentionally break my shield to regain the effect? If the latter, it seems fairly unintuitive, and I might recommend adding something like a 10 second internal timer on single-source long-duration shields.

I feel like overheal will be insanely strong with shield bash if you don't give this a long cd.

It won't be insanely strong.

Remember, you can only stack Overheal with Lifesteal and active heals (meaning, no Warmog's/Hp5/Ocean Drake/Grey Health). And Shield Bash only works once per shield!
Oh, well that settles it then. Nice, thanks Captain~!
Ty then.
Would be nice if Mordes worked
Are you sure? Because if that's the case, shouldn't the wording be "maximum 4 second proc window"?

> [{quoted}](name=xxxDogmanxxx,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EewyubPW,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-10-24T21:08:18.003+0000)

you assume all shields last 4 seconds.
Some shields are very short- the minimum is to normalize the duration.

> you assume all shields last 4 seconds.

Thank you for your answer, but please don't put words in my mouth. I didn't assume that all shields last 4 seconds at all.

> Some shields are very short- the minimum is to normalize the duration.

The source of my confusion is that "minimum" is supposed to means that the proc time will never go below 4 seconds, meaning 4 seconds is the least amount of time you have to wait before you can proc it. If they wanted to "normalize the duration" as you say, hen they should have not included the word minimum at all and should have just said "4 second proc window".

I'm fully aware that it wouldn't make much sense if they made it this way, which is why I'm confused in the first place.
I believe "Upon obtaining a shield, auto attacking within 4 seconds while shield is still active..." is better wording
Yes, that is much better.

> [{quoted}](name=xxxDogmanxxx,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EewyubPW,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-10-24T21:08:18.003+0000)
>
> Are you sure? Because if that's the case, shouldn't the wording be "maximum 4 second proc window"?

I agree with your questioning, because the wording makes it sound like you need to have a shield for 4 seconds before you can proc the buff. It could also mean that the proc window increases with level, but this doesn't make much sense.
Does shield bash only proc on self-generated shields? Or can you be shielded and still gain the buff?
Only self shields. Lulu cant shield Kog and Kog procs his shield bash, but Taric W on himself or Nautilus W triggers it.

In other words..... You can technically proc this rune up to 6 times a second.

If for example a Lethal Tempo Twitch with {{item:3080}} takes it, and has a {{champion:40}} support, He can literally proc it 6 times a second as long as his Health keeps dropping/gaining to max and into shield territory.

(This theoretical is based around the assumption that He has his own shield, Janna has hers, and Janna's Ult is proccing Aery at close range. It's not realistic, but it gives you an idea of what an ADC can do with it)

Draven and Jinx are going to have a field day with this rune.

it procs on shield activation so you need your shield to be destroyed and then get it again which is kinda hard to do (and anyway its damage scale with bonus HP and shield strength,both things that you will miss with this item alone)

Read the comment you reply to.

Also, an Overheal/BT champ can have a shield of up to 560, so it's not exactly a weak shield. On an adc, it's more about the fact it can continually be renewed than the fact of how strong each hit is. On Jinx or Draven, the rune can add about 40 damage per hit, and they have an easy time of getting to the Barrier proc. And Every time they take damage, they can reproc it. And Jinx.... at her insane auto attack range, can actually based on her mechanics... reliably abuse this, because anyone who gets close to Jinx is dead, so the only damage she's taking is skill shots. If she's got {{item:3031}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3080}} , she can literally overheal into shield almost constantly.

The Bonus Health part of the equation isn't as important as the size of the shield, or the base damage, which outstrips Scorch, Cheap Shot, any non keystone damage rune.

Also, keep in mind that this is on hit physical damage for an adc, so that damage also will LIFE STEAL, speeding up the rate at which an adc gets to the heal.

>Also, an Overheal/BT champ can have a shield of up to 560

unless you can can heal for 560 + all the damage you took with one AA you will proc this rune when the shield is weaker (so less damage)
it's more likely to be 100/150 when you proc it

also this situation is going to happen only when you are enough fed to outheal their damage,which is not always going to happen and if it does you didn't need this bonus damage,you are already overfed

>On Jinx or Draven, the rune can add about 40 damage per hit

at lvl 18 where things like gathering storm or absolute focus would give you more damage with more reliability (you need your items and to get in this situation where you stay nearly full HP) + you don't have to take a resolve rune (others are not the best)


>keep in mind that this is on hit physical damage for an adc, so that damage also will LIFE STEAL

nope,lifesteal works only on the AA's direct damage,on hit effects and abilities won't heal you (you need spellvamp for that)

1) I'm just stating the potential, and Jinx can actually do that much life steal in one hit, since Fishbones + Runaan's almost triples her per hit Life steal. I'm more concerned about the fact an adc can dip in and out of the shield and abuse the BASE damage on the rune. If it wasn't for the Base being 10-39, plus a little, I don't think any adcs would take it. But 10-39 is a big deal compared to other runes.

2) Gathering Storm on AD champs does not add more than this rune at any point in realistic game lengths. It adds more base stats, which would be useful..... if Adc skills scaled high on AD (most don't..... 50-70% AD multipliers)

3) Why do you care about Resolve runes when now we have subrunes that you get to CHOOSE the base stats it gives? Resolve can still give AD or attack speed.

4) Depends on what ability it is and what it's classified as. Some abilities are attacks. Runaan's secondary targets count as attacks. Some skills are specifically designed to apply attack based on hit structures.

Fishbones' added damage does life steal. Draven's enhanced Axes life steal. Ezreal's Q can Both Life steal and Spell Vamp. MF's passive life steals. Vayne's added damage can life steal, just not crit.

Oh. I forgot: {{item:3031}} has a hidden passive as well: It applies Life steal to all sources of physical damage from attacks, AND all sources of Physical damage converted to True Damage (including Conqueror). It's a hidden mechanic added to deal with the fact IE's conversion reduces life steal viability if it doesn't behave that way toward true damage.

my guess is that, just from reading, you get the shield bash everytime you get a new shield. 
So let say J4 uses his W to cast a shield, you dont have the bash yet.
Janna shields J4, now you have a shield bash, you have 4 seconds to proc this(minimum 4s window).
and before you can proc this another teammate like lux shields you, now you've resetted the window since you got a new shield on top of a new shield not 100% sure, but my guess is that everytime you get a new shield while proc is up, you'll get a new time window, first bash might be 4sec, next 6sec, etc

or actually since i dont see any CD on the proc, it might be 
J4 shield, Janna shields J4, you get a proc
you proc shield bash (you have 4 sec to proc this)
if the shield hasnt expired and lux shields you on top of this you get another bash and this time the proc window might be longer. 
and so on everytime you get a shield on top of shield
